section.heading: Protection of emergency 2-way radio communications — Definition.
section.text: For the purpose of §§ 5-1306 to 5-1309, “emergency” means a condition or circumstance in which an individual is or is reasonably believed by the person transmitting a communication referred to in § 5-1307 to be in imminent danger of death or serious bodily harm or in which property is in imminent danger of damage or destruction.

annoGroup.heading: Section References
annoGroup.annotation: This section is referenced in § 5-1308 and § 5-1309.
